_comment_local_development: This file is copied to debate_config.json on first run. Edit debate_config.json for your local settings. debate_config.json is gitignored to protect secrets.
_comment_production: For production (Railway, Docker), use environment variables to override these settings. See DEPLOYMENT.md for full list of environment variables.

debate.topic: Should artificial intelligence be regulated by government oversight?

openrouter._comment: api_key can be set here OR via OPENROUTER_API_KEY environment variable (recommended for production)

system._comment_database_path: Leave null to use 'debates.db'. For production with persistent storage: set DATABASE_PATH env var to volume mount path

auth._comment_development_mode: Set to false in production. Can be overridden with AUTH_DEVELOPMENT_MODE=false env var

email._comment: All email settings can be overridden with environment variables: EMAIL_ENABLED, SMTP_SERVER, SMTP_PORT, SMTP_USER, SMTP_PASSWORD, SMTP_FROM_EMAIL, SMTP_FROM_NAME, SMTP_USE_TLS, FRONTEND_URL
email._comment_smtp_password: Use SMTP_PASSWORD environment variable in production (never commit passwords to git)
